Summary In my life I rely on principles of respect, honesty, trust and compromising. In my work I focus on quality, thoroughness, reliability and assertiveness. I work well independently and as a part of team. I have good capability of self learning and implementation of my knowledge in work. 
 
Now days I'm finishing my studies for Computer Science B.Sc. and looking for a job as SW developer or Quality Assurance person at full or partial position. I have wide experience as lab engineer at big company as well in serving private customers.

Experience Lab execution engineer Intel Corporation November 2004  –  April 2015  (10 years 6 months) Israel Tested new SW, HW and automation flows. Was responsible for system configuration regression and version management. Found numerous bugs, filed them in documentation and advanced bugs'​ resolving. All these resulted in tools and flows stabilization. 
 
Gave constant support to lab computing systems which are critical components in CPU validation process. The activity included tracking of SW and HW changes, implementing reworks and installing new SW versions. In time of execution I founded a lot of environment and infrastructure issues and resolved them myself when it was possible or with help of relevant teams. In addition I was a backup of validation contact person and in time of his absence applied content changes on execution systems. 
 
I was dedicated as single person to migrate Broadwell CPU execution activity from Malaysia to Israel site. After that I continued alone to run execution of this project. The activity included HW and SW update, content configuration, daily interaction with different teams in Israel and abroad including weekly synchronization meetings with project leads and other involved teams over the world. 
 
Ramped up new technicians by sharing knowledge and training them with relevant skills to make their lab work more effective and quality. 
 
Was administrator of department and execution team web-sites built on the Microsoft SharePoint application platform. This included responsibility on frequent sites' content update, management of user permissions, migration of sites to the new SharePoint versions every several years and daily technical support of other sites admins and regular users in over the world. 
 
Volunteered many times to organize team events. As part of this activity I made many calls and verification with suppliers, took in account special needs of employees and managed different financial aspects.  Computer Technician Self-employment February 2001  –  October 2004  (3 years 9 months) Israel Giving support for private customers in computer maintenance area. This included giving support at customers' home, by phone and in remote assistance.
